website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive louver/mesh combo screen will fit both narrow and wide windows.
pros: Stands 10 inches tall and is adjustable from 21 to 37 inches wide
Metal louvers offer privacy and rain protection
Painted metal rails, varnished wood ends, and zinc-plated nails for durability
Sturdy corners keep the screen square
cons: The louvers block light, and some owners say they don’t let enough air through them

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: We live in the dessert with high winds. Every time we open a window we get tons of dust. I didn’t know a window filter was a thing but thankfully found this one. I just installed this and it was super easy! The filter has a clean foam smell that I’m sure will go away soon. So far I’m very happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier. I was nervous about this as I live in a noble home and don't have traditional windows. Not a worry, the units fit perfectly in the window groves. Installation was under 20 seconds. They also are very well constructed especially for the price. No regrets
customer_reviews.author: DAveAdams

customer_reviews.title: totally not what i wanted
customer_reviews.text: just opened my screen. the thing is very difficult to open, The sides stick and scrapes the paint off the metal. the screens are sticking along the top and the bottom and buckles toward the edges. The frames fit on the ends but buckle towards the middle also. To add injury, my hand got caught and pinched when I tried to close it. The foam pokes out on one end. I think I'm done!
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Ford

customer_reviews.title: The venting slits feature
customer_reviews.text: Over all I would order again. My only problem I have with it is the track for adjusting the width. Sometimes not always it sticks. It is a metal track not vinyl. The one feature I like and the reasons I got it was the design of the venting slits on the one side to allow for airflow but keep rain out as long as you have it installed with vents facing down and no high winds to force the rain in and allows for privacy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected, high winds before the snow made it noticeable (lots less particles flying in the window) just wish they had a bigger size for casement windows. I had to double up to make sure coverage was on the open part. Was able to notice in the sunlight how the dust was reduced. Probably gonna order more for every window before summer/spring is back.
customer_reviews.author: Just a regular guy

customer_reviews.title: I guess they are good.
customer_reviews.text: I will update the review after a few months of use. I bought another for my room because needed it. The aqua green part is pretty strong, but don't like that it was made with wood on the edges, wish it was rubber on the edges, has more support if it was a bendable rubber tube. So far so good. They keep the dust and dirt outside and the outside of the filter is dirty. This can be washed thank God Amen. Ugh, no buying replacement filters.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: well made,may want to duct-tape for firm install
customer_reviews.text: we use this in doorway to keep dachshund puppy out of the bathroom with the catbox. Our cats can jump it, household members can easily step over it. Just be sure to warn guests or remove before having company. Less expensive than a typical gate.
customer_reviews.author: P. duMont

customer_reviews.title: Airflow and privacy
customer_reviews.text: Simple product. Allows airflow through the window. The feature I thought I wouldn't care for, however, became a very nice addition. The air vents instead of just a screen offers some privacy which I realized was wanted while using this in an office with a window directly behind me. It also directs airflow, which is nice. A useful addition. Otherwise, the product is made well enough and fits well in all the windows I've tried- multiple sizes, wood frames, storm windows etc. Nice and inexpensive way to open up the room or house without letting everything in.
customer_reviews.author: Jasonmwa

customer_reviews.title: Great at keeping the rain out, but not much air flow
customer_reviews.text: These are great for keeping the rain out, although I did have one get blown out of a window during an especially windy rainstorm. However, I would mostly just use them if I was leaving the house when there might be a possibility of rain, or at night while I am sleeping (in case it rains). The air flow from outside to inside is severely restricted when using them, so you won't get any breeze blowing through the house if you use them all over.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Bee

customer_reviews.title: Gives me a bit more privacy in bedroom window that's about 6' away from neighbor.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly like described. Arrived in excellent condition.. I like this, a bit flimsy, but does the job. I'd like one w/more height, but for now its OK. The 'green foam' is thin, if it was thick, might not have air flow. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bakerlady13

customer_reviews.title: there is hardly air come through to my room after this
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be a good product for blocking the rain or even mosquito. However, it may be too protective that the air is hardly coming in after I've put it up for my window. I have to use my old one back after several days since there is no fresh air comes in after I've put it up. It may be good if your region rain a lot, otherwise, I would just use a normal screen window for more fresh air.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: These are a must
customer_reviews.text: This allergy season was killing me, but i can't afford to keep the AC on all day long to avoid the pollens. Here in my city, it's rather cool at night, so i like to keep the windows open with a window fan. this was the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: kai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to add ventilation to a window without worry of rain getting inside!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this exact product for decades, and wouldn't do without it! As older units are damaged (like with this purchase), I simply replace them. I keep them in most of spring, summer, & fall-and can still open the window over them if I need more air! Very happy (still) with product, purchase price, delivery, and overall quality.
customer_reviews.author: KennyG

customer_reviews.title: Blocks view for street side window
customer_reviews.text: I put this in front of a window fan for a window on the street side of my house. It perfectly blocks the view and still vents well. It blends in well with a gray house with white windows. It is make from light weight metal and I have yet to try it, but a portable air conditioner house can be set up behind the screen to vent out the window.
customer_reviews.author: viva Jiro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs and far nicer than simple flimsy sliding screen units.
customer_reviews.text: We just had some work done to our 115 year old house, including a grey meal roof and some new windows. The windows were screen-optional, which we liked. MN has few months that need wide-open windows and out cats wreck the screens. On brutal hot days we close up and use A/C. The gray color of these work well with the house and, contrary to instructions, we put the screen side out...away from cats. They look nice from the outside, far nicer than simple flimsy sliding screen units. Made in USA by hard-working people in New Jersey.
customer_reviews.author: That ACPress Guy

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: I'm relatively happy with the dust blocking of this screen and don't mind the color as much as I thought I would. It does, however block air flow to a great extent, not allowing cooler air to come in, which is a shame b/c it's about 90 degrees outside, so I'd like more breeze. Not sure something can be designed, however, to allow both breeze and dust blocking at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: K M

customer_reviews.title: This is a great idea but the unit is very difficult to expand ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea but the unit is very difficult to expand and contract. So much so that its almost impossible to make it fit into the window. Its possible that the two I had were exceptions but they were unusable for me.
customer_reviews.author: William Kautter

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE ITEM
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE ITEM... Out of the box it fell apart in my hands. The flimsy little clips used to keep it together were already broken off and I could not get them back on. Cheap is cheap.... as this proves. I stuck it in the window anyway because I really needed it instead of bothering to return this piece of junk. Shop elsewhere for a more sturdy quality and you will be happier.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! I was skeptical at first when I read that I could leave them in when it rains. Not any more. :-) We get some gully washer rains here in Florida, these little screens deflect the water just fine. I so much enjoy the ability to have open windows to catch the breezes and not have to shut them for every little rain shower.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Finally I can open my windows!!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly into windows and still able to get some airflow. Brought this because of my allergies and during the winter time we get alot of heat so with windows slightly opened and these filters I'm hoping all will be more comfortable this winter. I also put a window wedge to stop windows from being able to open when I'm not home.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: When the clerk at the P.O. handed me the big box, I knew there was a change that the louvered screen would be broken because the box was really smashed in. I got home and opened the box and yes....it is broken.. I tried to fix it, but beyond my pay grade. All thumbs. It won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Glorycloud

customer_reviews.title: Thermwell Products  rain breakers
customer_reviews.text: Came when they said it would.Great service,even had one come damaged and it was replaced very fast.These are nice looking,not to big,fits every window we have.Really keeps the rain out,even when it was windy outside,no rain came in.Thinking of buying four more for the bedrooms.Easy to put in the window or even leave in the window.Note:if you plan to leave them in for any time and not be home ask your alarm people to change the location of alarm for this.Some may charge you to do this,but ours came with it in the contract free service. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong item twice.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it is any good. I ordered one that was designed to allow air in but keep rain out. Got what is just an Adjustible screen. I returned it and requested the one I wanted again. I a received the same one again. I put it on my shid still in the box. It was not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Filter doesn't do much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this screen for my NYC apartment window because a lot of dirt and particles were coming through my regular window screen. I had hoped that the additional micromesh filter (looks like cotton batting) would allow fewer particles to enter through the window, but it doesn't provide much more protection than a regular screen. In addition, the green color plus the filter make it opaque. It's not worth losing light from the window if the filter doesn't block out more dirt and particles.
customer_reviews.author: Italophile

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, super easy and the packaging was adequate
customer_reviews.text: Took these right out of the box, tore off the tags and put them into our windows! Could NOT have been easier. The louvers are nice, the over all product seems well made for the price. The packaging was fine (I ordered 3 of them and they came in a sturdy box so no warping issues). The only glitch is that there's a small gap on the top of them where they are a little uneven. I plan to use some foam to solve the problem - so really only a minor complaint. Already, the cool breeze coming through is heavenly. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Bowling

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: They are well made, great allergen filters! I usually need to take allergy meds every day but after placing these on my window I can say my allergies aren’t as active. Great product, wish it came in smaller sizes for my other windows.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bravo

customer_reviews.title: It's a window screen TaDa
customer_reviews.text: It's a screen for a window. I bought a few at the local hardware but didn't have enough. I got this one and was kinda surprised. It seemed sturdier than the ones I bought but I didn't care for the metal vents over the mesh. 5hat seemed counter productive.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Wells

customer_reviews.title: These are a godsend to keep out rain (and most of the humidity), while still letting some air in.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these little rain-guard screens! I've used them for many, many years - got my original ones from our hometown hardware many years ago. Needed a few more, but the new owners of that hardware didn't have them in stock. So... Amazon to the rescue. These little rain-guard screens are among the most useful things I own.
customer_reviews.author: JR64

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great product, perfect for stopping kitty’s from ripping the screen, also blocks close neighbors from seeing in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good product
customer_reviews.text: Not overly pleased with this ventilation screen as the way its bad the screen does not allow much air to pass through and the expanding/contracting handling for the screen is a pain in the you know what.
customer_reviews.author: New York

customer_reviews.title: Window ventilator
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is a nice window ventilator. Portable and fits most windows. I use it all over my house. I purchased this item about 2 years ago and finally giving it a review. Good product for the price. And still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Leala Jew

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great as a privacy screen in bathroom, able to open the window and leave open just close the windows with privacy film about an inch below the top with this between the window and the screen
customer_reviews.author: JBender

customer_reviews.title: Seems well-made, time will tell, but ...
customer_reviews.text: ... I wish they also made one ~5 inches high with other specs the same. I don't really need or want the window open ~10 inches. Still gave it 5 stars because this version more than met my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: TallyMan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed, for a window without a screen
customer_reviews.text: Bought a wonderful new window for an upstairs bathroom, but never thought about getting one with a screen. Wanted to be able to leave it open, without having rain coming in. This was exactly what I was looking for, but could not find - began to think they didn't exist anymore.
customer_reviews.author: I Like to Do Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good quality, especially for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me, let some air in but keep the mice and bugs out in my ground floor apartment. If I had to guess I would have expected this to cost at least $20 based on the build quality but I paid $8.
customer_reviews.author: Lee in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Vent screens were my solution.
customer_reviews.text: The product is fantastic and was the perfect solution to my problem. I have a very large unfinished attic that gets very hot in the summer I have Gable end vents and four double hung windows at the north and south ends. Problem was simple just open up the windows at either end for lots of air but also lots of rain! As you can tell these were a perfect fix and I would recommend them all day every day!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: If its your only option...
customer_reviews.text: They are what is advertised. but really, 1/8 of foam.. if you already have screens, should just tape some foam to them... be the same as this thing. I you don't have a screen this may be your only option but its pretty week.
customer_reviews.author: boeyc15

customer_reviews.title: i like it!
customer_reviews.text: keeps the bugs away and some dust when i open my window. i don't have any negative about the screen it just work. make sure you look at length of your window that it long enough for your window.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: vent is not removable
customer_reviews.text: we love it works great easy to put in the screen door window just the right size
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.text: While this works well, my Windows are on the narrow end and most of the space ends up with double louvers which doesn't allow much air to pass through. If this came in a narrower size (or my Windows were wider), it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: mariee

customer_reviews.title: Fits my window great - it's adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Fits my window great - it's adjustable. Washable so I won't have to buy another one. I even use it now in the winter! I think it would be better to have the end pieces be weather protected metal as I'm afraid after washing it the wood is eventually going to rot.
customer_reviews.author: imfaithdriven

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent for rainy or windy weather
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent for rainy or windy weather. The screens can be set in the window with the metal screen turned up or down. Good quality metal and slides easily left or right, I ordered 5 and wished I had ordered a few more for our glassed in porch. The ventilators lets in as much air as you need. The wood around the screens are a nice weight
customer_reviews.author: A. J.

customer_reviews.title: Careful when purchasing theses items
customer_reviews.text: This purchase really sucks, because screens were very difficult to adjust( expand & contract), as though they stuck & stored over a period in a warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Temple

customer_reviews.title: I like them and they work
customer_reviews.text: Just bought these online here, as you can't find them in hardware stores anymore. Don't know why, as they're very handy to have. They don't let a lot of air circulation in, but they do let some in. You notice it a lot more in the spring or fall when the air is a lot cooler outside, and you can leave the window up even when raining. These are okay, and will work for the use intended, but not made as heavy or as well as they used to be, but then what is? I like them and they work.
customer_reviews.author: JayP

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: To the screen arrived with a whole in it and it is quite flimsey. It is also sticky to adjust and when it does finally move, it pulls the green foam lining. I am not looking forward to having to clean the foam and put it back together.
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: No aid circulation
customer_reviews.text: Does not let air circulation. It was great to keep my cats away from the screen but wasn't any good for air circulation. Didn't try to return on time now I'm stuck them.
customer_reviews.author: Doree

customer_reviews.title: Short but do the trick
customer_reviews.text: These screens are shorter than I am used to (10" really isn't very tall) but they do the job. Even a heavy rain doesn't get through.
customer_reviews.author: Erin W

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Fits anywhere. Perfect for added privacy with ventilation. It's nice to get a nice new clean one after many years of the old one!
customer_reviews.author: Tallie365

customer_reviews.title: great little screens, very good value
customer_reviews.text: I have screens, but I use these sliding screens to keep my cat from getting too close to the existing screens and the edge of the windows, extra protection for the cat, so to speak. (not strong enough for children!)
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: A little pricey but keep the pollen outside
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey but keep a lot of the dust & pollen out of the house when we run the whole-house fan. They do reduce the fan's airflow but it's worth the tradeoff if you have allergies. Use in multiple windows to get the airflow back up. Probably need 2x the window opening square inches filtered vs without filter. The filter is washable so you only need to buy them once.
customer_reviews.author: Senior Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Air In —Water Out
customer_reviews.text: Work gine Allow me to keep window open during rain storms so as to insure fresh air without water
customer_reviews.author: SPINNERBUG

customer_reviews.title: Glad these are still made.  Great product
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this product. Needed these to put in my upstairs windows so they could be left open. You can leave the Windows open even in rain. Had an old one from 40years ago but these are so much better. Love the ease to put them in and the fact you do not have to hurry to close a window.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The ventilators we received....one was missing a clip to hold one of the corners together with the slide and the other had the scree ripped in several places as well as one slide was separated from the other and the clips that hold it together were not in the tracks. SAD!!!
customer_reviews.author: peter souza

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste you money
customer_reviews.text: It was bent when it got here and the thought of sending it back after it took this long to get here i might as well just go to Home Depot....
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jepsen

customer_reviews.title: Decent price for quality
customer_reviews.text: Work fine. Only about 45% air goes threw though, 100% sound ,but not rain. 4 stars because it started to rust in 3 days. I painted the wood but the metal rusts.
customer_reviews.author: Ratherbshooting

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered very quickly excellent quality I have a portable AC units that you put a tube out the window, this covers that up beautifully
customer_reviews.author: Frank Roycroft

customer_reviews.title: Allows fresh air and prevents cats from escaping
customer_reviews.text: We used these to allow fresh air into the house and to prevent our cats from tearing the window screens and escaping. Works perfectly. Sturdy construction and easy to install and remove.
customer_reviews.author: catzafun

customer_reviews.title: Heat out and rain too
customer_reviews.text: I use them in my attic window which I keep open during the summer, to let the heat out. These units will let the heat out and keep the rain out. So I can keep the windows open all summer.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Dick

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: These worked to keep a determined cat inside, although I had to add a slide stop because she figured out that she could slide it to the side and get to the screen anyways without that. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy in construction
customer_reviews.text: Was better than expected. Seems well constructed and the vents do add privacy to the room that I used it in.
customer_reviews.author: LilLouLou

customer_reviews.title: I Could Not Be Happier, Looks Good And Plenty Of Fresh Air With Privacy
customer_reviews.text: Just got them glad I bought 3 they are awesome exactly as pictured 1 East to open the sliding runs smoothly 2 Easily installs in window 3 You can peek out through the openings without being seen by others 4 Nice air flow comes trough the vents, when the wind picks up no curtains flying around wildly like they do with just a screen 5 With a fan in front of it works great
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: This filter helps to keep clean air in your home
customer_reviews.text: I used it to prevent pollen and particulates from entering my bedroom. I feel that it helps my breathing. It has to be washed every month. My pulmonary function tests have remained stable since I began using this window filter
customer_reviews.author: henry Stern

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to slide
customer_reviews.text: It is REALLY hard to open. I ended up putting oil on it to be able to slide it completely.
customer_reviews.author: tornadoalley

customer_reviews.title: Greenish screen
customer_reviews.text: Be careful taking out of the box it can bend. It’s a little stiff. Otherwise does what I want it to do.
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I was surprised it actually kept odors like smoke out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Cast

customer_reviews.title: Cheap screen
customer_reviews.text: Got this because they no longer make the one I used to have (it fell out my bathroom window into the abyss of the air shaft). Works for privacy. I slid the ends apart to install in my window and the wood on the left side came loose. It is held in place by a tiny, bent nail. I am not taking it in and out of the window so it "works" fine. However, I don't like that it broke before I even installed it. Grrrr
customer_reviews.author: lady jane

customer_reviews.title: well made screen.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product, stays in my window all year, would buy again for sure,
customer_reviews.author: MARCIA C.

customer_reviews.title: A Solution!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mother. This works great in her apartment that tends to have an abundance of heat. She needs to open the window in all weather to get fresh air in.
customer_reviews.author: ADK Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I can now keep mu window open while it's raining. I wish I would have bought more.
customer_reviews.author: tlc

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy but it works
customer_reviews.text: It is a little on the flimsy side but it works and except for when I get a really high blowing rain (like 50mph winds and up), it allows me to keep the window open when it rains without it coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne S

customer_reviews.title: You can't look through them that well
customer_reviews.text: I love this screen, the only problem you won't be able to look out of your window through them other then that I love it and it really keeps the rain outside
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap screen
customer_reviews.text: Just got then today. Screen ripped when I shortened one after fitting into my bathroom window.
customer_reviews.author: chunita swint

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful slidiing screen for cheap money
customer_reviews.text: This was a great sliding screen for the dollar.I love it. Fred
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for older window and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I didn't order one of these sooner. We lost the screen out of a room a few years ago and it was an old window - odd size. To buy a new screen was expensive. This worked perfectly. Even my husband is impressed! Its so much sturdier than I thought it would be and easy to take in and out.
customer_reviews.author: lisajotheshoppinghoTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Screen in
customer_reviews.text: The screens are very nice and sturdy. I forsee having/using them for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: keeps rain out
customer_reviews.text: I don't worry about the windows being left open, no rain comes in. I like to listen to the rain. good buy and very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Frost King Ventilators with Screens
customer_reviews.text: We have about 6 or 8 of these now and they're great. They allow you to leave windows open when it rains and they add privacy.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: My apartment bedroom doesn't have a screen so I purchased this to allow some air flow without the birds and bugs encroaching my territory. Just pop it in and voila!
customer_reviews.author: ScChick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little screen
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little screen- exactly as expected. Arrived undamaged and well packaged. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Replace it with a better one
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't. Fit very well and still see cracks from it0 it's lousy I want a refund it broke in the first week
customer_reviews.author: Mary love

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars
customer_reviews.text: We recently rented a house in NC that has no screens in any of the windows. Seriously.... 17 windows in the house and not a single screen. How do you have a house in NC without screens in the windows??? Well anyway,we purchased several of these screens to use now that the weather has cooled off and the a/c has been turned off. They do the job... allow us to get some air into the house and keeping most of the bugs out.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Roo

customer_reviews.title: Keep the dust out
customer_reviews.text: It really stopped the dust and pollen from coming thru the window...
customer_reviews.author: Barrington Ford

customer_reviews.title: Bent upscreen. Bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: This screen was bent up when I received. Too bad box got wet so I couldnt return.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the rain out when windy
customer_reviews.text: We sleep with our windows open, so when it was raining and windy in the past we had to close them. This allows fresh air to come in without the rain water. If I had any complaint, it would be that they don't make them in a larger size (taller than 10 inches).
customer_reviews.author: John Marston

customer_reviews.title: Works just right
customer_reviews.text: Good to keep the bugs and rain out. Doesn't stop the air from flowing in
customer_reviews.author: SG&H1/9

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Needed to air out a room on the 2nd level of my house while painting and there were no window screens! This was the perfect fit to allow the room to air out and it kept the critters and bugs out! Great price and they arrived really fast!
customer_reviews.author: KayPee

customer_reviews.title: Great when it's raining
customer_reviews.text: Using these screens allows me to keep the windows open even though it's pouring rain outside. The vents keep the water out and allows air in. Also the vents are screened so no bugs can fly in. Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Frost King Ventilators with screens
customer_reviews.text: I got the frost ventilators with screens which I needed. I am not happy that I got 2 boxes which I order the screens only and I got a box with 2 ladders that I did not ordered.
customer_reviews.author: wanda valentin

customer_reviews.title: My cats love them
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed so my cats can get fresh air even when it is raining.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Bargain ¡
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit old dorm window had to return. I thought it was a bargain pretty well constructed for the price ! I read other reviews and some said it was cheaply made it could serve the purpose for me but didn't fit. Dorm is old and so are our windows. I measure and this fit the width but it wouldn't stay in place. Not a design issue though
customer_reviews.author: Jazzin' in Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Great item to allow air flow safely.Good quality,very well made and does what its meant to do.Allows for privacy and protection from the weather.Perfect to allow the cool breezes in.I bought 5 of these and I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CarKar.

customer_reviews.title: Surprising quality versus price.
customer_reviews.text: Actually very well made. I thought they would be of cheaper quality because of the price. Very pleased. Keep up the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R. Klemm

customer_reviews.title: Helps
customer_reviews.text: I don't have ventilation in my garage so I put this in my window to vent hot air out and keep insects out! It helps!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Swinimer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, not smooth opening
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a pain to slide open and closed. However, it was PERFECT for my needs--trying to ventilate my room, but keep out the rain. Unfortunately it was too small for my window, but that was my fault not measuring. I wish I could find a bigger one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Hedge Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Let's air in and keeps rain out!
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have so I can keep a couple of windows open for fresh air and NOT have to worry about it raining.
customer_reviews.author: John in South Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, they are a little on the flimsy side. Not that easy to slide open or close. A good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: GB-NH

customer_reviews.title: Great I'm going to order two more
customer_reviews.text: I love it live on the first floor and was worried about people looking in and it also keeps the bugs out..
customer_reviews.author: shantasia fee

customer_reviews.title: works well for its purpose
customer_reviews.text: As long as the rain is not stormy and windy, it has worked well for its purpose (air exchange). No rust so far.
customer_reviews.author: Log73

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but don’t expect much air flow
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy yes, but does not vent the way as described. There is a fan in our window and still pulls in basically no outside air. The vents are cut very close and not enough opening. Very disappointed😣
customer_reviews.author: R Zayah

customer_reviews.title: a perfect fit and well made
customer_reviews.text: fits perfectly in my window and has kept the pollen out of my apartment as stated. the delivery was on time and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P

product_meta.title: Frost King Ventilators with Screens, 10" High, Fits 21 -37" Wide
product_meta.description:
Size Name:10" x 21 - 37"10-Inch x 21-Inch - 37-Inch Louver Metal Rail Extension. Window screen extends from 21-Inch to 37-Inch. Painted metal rails and varnished wood ends. Extra sturdy, tenoned corners that keep screens square. Comes with zinc-plated nails.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
10-Inch x 21-Inch - 37-Inch Louver Metal Rail Extension. Window screen extends from 21-Inch to 37-Inch. Painted metal rails, and varnished wood ends. Extra sturdy, tenoned corners that keep screens square. Comes with zinc-plated nails.
feature_bullets: Painted metal rails & varnished wood ends
Painted Metal Rails, And Varnished Wood Ends
Extra Sturdy, Tenoned Corners That Keep Screens Square
